rComments: Doc thinks he's all that.  If you want to take a class with a professor who really wants to be "cool"???   then this is the class for you.

Doc is the absolute best. Just show up to class and you're golden. There's a bit of weekly reading, but nothing's too long and it's all rather interesting and oftentimes, hilarious. Take his class and laugh your ass off! You won't regret it

Doc is a fantastic professor. His Monsters class is a very entertaining course, but you also learn a lot of important information as well. Doc will hand you the EASIEST A ever if you simply read all of the plays and other readings he assigns. It isn't too much work, and the plays are actually a lot of fun to read. I would take any class Doc teaches

Doc tells a lot of jokes, but don't mistake his casualness for lack depth or expertise. Thanks to this class, I understand art better than I ever have before. This class is mildly challenging and really expects you to engage with the material. If you do, you should learn a ton and have lots of fun along the way. If you don't, you will suffer.

Super funny, a true inspiration.  He will change the way you look upon the world. He'll teach you things that will broaden your mind about everything in life. Don't expect any classes by him as an easy GE though. Show him respect and he'll respect you.

This class was both fun and kind of a game-changer for me. Discovered some really meaningful stuff about myself by learning about monsters and mythology. Doc really knows what he's talking about and goes out of his way to make the course fun and interesting. As an easy GE class, go for it (as long as you read the short plays and show up.)
This professor is the most funny and interesting person that you'll ever meet.

I hate Chemer's quizzes for the readings, he pretends like they're going to be easy, and yeah like one of the questions out of 5 usually are easy and the answer is glaringly obvious, but not all. Most of the time u get like a 25. He has very tricky questions, it's like he wants you to get it wrong. I DO the readings too!
I HOPE HE NEVER CHANGES!!!! HE IS AN AWESOME HUMAN BEING.

Doc is great. Just don't be totally lazy and remember to attend lecture because a lot of the midterm questions or updates on assignments are from there. Plus he's hilarious, who wouldn't wanna go to lecture?? He's so cool, I wish he was my dad. Cute personality, dresses cute too, and has a great laugh.

Doc Chemers is an amazing professor. He's funny, enthusiastic, and insanely invested in his lectures. The mandatory class isn't even an issue because you'll never want to skip. I'd take this class again in a heartbeat.

This class is amazing! Doc. is absolutely hilarious and genuinely concerned about his students. There's a decent amount of reading but they're mostly stories instead of dense academic articles. There's a midterm, weekly quizzes, discussion posts and final project. Semi a lot of work but it's worth it. Highly recommend this class!

Amazing professor I was not super excited to take this class I really just needed another class and I could not have picked a better one. A lot of reading but his lectures are hilarious and insightful. You will look at the world in a new way

Literally the best teacher I have ever had. I nominated him for the excellence in teaching award, no joke. His classes could be hard for some but he CARES about his students and is COMMITTED to their success. He is the most helpful teacher I have ever encountered.

don't ever even think about taking this class unless you're legitimately interested in the subject. Lectures are SO tedious and lengthy and he always goes off topic. there's HELLA reading and the in-class quizzes can/will screw you over unless you actually do all the work (two books/week + posting on a discussion forum). his humor gets old/annoying
Such a fun guy teaching a not so fun class, but he makes it bearable and fun. Extremely funny, very knowledgeable in his field and very personable. Never a dull moment.

Course relied highly on you having read the plays. The quarter progressed in a logical manner, easy to follow. He is a great lecturer, never a dull moment! Also very approachable and helpful, just a great person. I was never interested in theater, but his class opened my eyes and showed me how interesting and integral to everyday life it is.

I loved this class. He was really funny and it was enjoyable going to class. I learned about a lot of things in this class that I had not really thought about before. There were no midterms nor finals. The only thing he asked of us was that we go to each class, post in the discussions, and do a 4 page research paper. Overall, this was a cool class.

Professor Chemers constantly makes inappropriate comments and wastes class time. Guest speakers spoke on Thursdays and Chemers spoke on Tuesdays. There was a final paper and weekly discussion posts online about the speakers. I appreciate the laxness but I would have liked to learn something, not just waste time

He was awesome. I did all the work that he clearly stated we needed to do and I got over a hundred in this class. He is always willing to help his students succeed. You need to read the plays and go to class tho. Otherwise, it is an easy class and fun too!
One of those easy classes that the professor tries to make hard. too much work for no reason, read and you will do fine. LEctures can be boring unless you are a theatre major

Best class I have ever taken. Easy A if you do the work, which isn't even that hard. Mr Chemers is by far the funniest teacher I have ever had and not only is he very humorous he is very knowledgeable about the subject. Monsters is very interesting and fun and you can't fall asleep in class. MUST TAKE.

One of the most entertaining professors that I have ever met. Not only is Chemers a very knowledgeable man, but also a humorous one as well. He exhibits a certain aura that allows students to easily connect with him. Although his courses may be quite rigorous, if you have any opportunity to take his courses, do it.
Lectures are entertaining, keep you interested, he's funny and clear about his expectations. Everything you are graded on is in the syllabus.
